commands.name: az elastic monitor associate-traffic-filter
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor associate-traffic-filter [--ids]
                                            [--monitor-name]
                                            [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                            [--resource-group]
                                            [--ruleset-id]
                                            [--subscription]
examples: az elastic monitor associate-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg --ruleset-id

commands.name: az elastic monitor create
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor create --monitor-name
                          --resource-group
                          [--generate-api-key {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--location]
                          [--monitoring-status {Disabled, Enabled}]
                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--plan-details]
                          [--saa-s-azure-subscription-status]
                          [--sku]
                          [--source-campaign-id]
                          [--source-campaign-name]
                          [--subscription-state]
                          [--tags]
                          [--user-info]
                          [--version]
examples: az elastic monitor create -n monitor-name -g rg --user-info "{firstName:Alice,lastName:bob,companyName:Micosoft,emailAddress:alice@microsoft.com}" --sku "{name:ess-consumption-2024_Monthly}"

commands.name: az elastic monitor create-and-associate-ip-filter
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor create-and-associate-ip-filter [--ids]
                                                  [--ips]
                                                  [--monitor-name]
                                                  [--name]
                                                  [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                  [--resource-group]
                                                  [--subscription]
examples: az elastic monitor create-and-associate-ip-filter --monitor-name name -g rg --name name --ips  192.168.131.0, 192.168.132.6/22

commands.name: az elastic monitor create-and-associate-pl-filter
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor create-and-associate-pl-filter [--ids]
                                                  [--monitor-name]
                                                  [--name]
                                                  [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                                  [--private-endpoint-guid]
                                                  [--private-endpoint-name]
                                                  [--resource-group]
                                                  [--subscription]
examples: az elastic monitor create-and-associate-pl-filter --monitor-name monitor -g rg --name name

commands.name: az elastic monitor create-or-update-external-user
examples: az monitor create-or-update-external-user --monitor-name {monitor} -g {rg} --user-name newuser --full-name fullname --password password --email-id email@outlook.com --roles [admin,other_role]

commands.name: az elastic monitor delete
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor delete [--ids]
                          [--monitor-name]
                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--resource-group]
                          [--subscription]
                          [--yes]
examples: az elastic monitor delete -n monitor -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor delete-traffic-filter
examples: az elastic monitor delete-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg --ruleset-id id

commands.name: az elastic monitor detach-and-delete-traffic-filter
examples: az elastic monitor detach-and-delete-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg --ruleset-id id

commands.name: az elastic monitor detach-traffic-filter
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor detach-traffic-filter [--ids]
                                         [--monitor-name]
                                         [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                         [--resource-group]
                                         [--ruleset-id]
                                         [--subscription]
examples: az elastic monitor detach-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg --ruleset-id

commands.name: az elastic monitor get-billing-info
commands.summary: Get marketplace and organization info mapped to the given monitor.
examples: az elastic monitor get-billing-info --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor

commands.name: az elastic monitor list
commands.summary: List all monitors under the specified resource group. And List all                                monitors under the specified subscription.
examples: az elastic monitor list -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-all-traffic-filter
examples: az elastic monitor list-all-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-associated-traffic-filter
examples: az elastic monitor list-associated-traffic-filter --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-connected-partner-resource
commands.summary: List of all active deployments that are associated with the marketplace subscription linked to the given monitor.
examples: az elastic monitor list-connected-partner-resource --resource-group myResourceGroup --monitor-name myMonitor

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-deployment-info
commands.summary: Fetch information regarding Elastic cloud deployment corresponding to                                the Elastic monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor list-deployment-info --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-resource
commands.summary: List the resources currently being monitored by the Elastic monitor                                resource.
examples: az elastic monitor list-resource --monitor-name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-upgradable-version
examples: az elastic monitor list-upgradable-version --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor list-vm-host
commands.summary: List the vm resources currently being monitored by the Elastic                                monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor list-vm-host --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor show
commands.summary: Get the properties of a specific monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor show -n name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor update
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor update [--add]
                          [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--generate-api-key {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--identity]
                          [--ids]
                          [--monitor-name]
                          [--monitoring-status {Disabled, Enabled}]
                          [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                          [--plan-details]
                          [--remove]
                          [--resource-group]
                          [--saa-s-azure-subscription-status]
                          [--set]
                          [--sku]
                          [--source-campaign-id]
                          [--source-campaign-name]
                          [--subscription]
                          [--subscription-state]
                          [--tags]
                          [--version]
examples: az elastic monitor update -n monitor -g rg --tags "{tag:test,tag1:test1}"

commands.name: az elastic monitor update-vm-collection
commands.summary: Update the vm details that will be monitored by the Elastic monitor                                resource.
examples: az elastic monitor update-vm-collection --monitor-name monitor1 -g rg --operation-name Add --vi-resource-id id

commands.name: az elastic monitor upgrade
commands.syntax:
az elastic monitor upgrade [--ids]
                           [--monitor-name]
                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                           [--resource-group]
                           [--subscription]
                           [--version]
examples: az elastic monitor upgrade -g rg --monitor-name monitor --version 8.0.0

commands.name: az elastic monitor vm-ingestion-detail
commands.summary: List the vm ingestion details that will be monitored by the Elastic                                monitor resource.
examples: az elastic monitor vm-ingestion-detail --monitor-name name -g rg

commands.name: az elastic monitor wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
